meanings.definition: A building or buildings occupied by a community of monks living under religious vows.
meanings.sent1: The ancient monasteries were peaceful places where monks lived and prayed.
meanings.sent2: The monasteries in the valley were known for their beautiful architecture.
meanings.sent3: The monks in the monasteries had a strict schedule but always found time for laughter.
meanings.sent4: The monasteries stood like silent guardians, watching over the surrounding countryside.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the monasteries felt like stepping back in time to a simpler way of life.

meanings.definition: A community of monks or nuns living together under religious vows.
meanings.sent1: The monasteries in the mountains were self-sufficient communities.
meanings.sent2: She decided to join the monasteries to dedicate her life to prayer and service.
meanings.sent3: The monasteries held a bake-off to see who could make the best bread.
meanings.sent4: Their bond was as strong as the walls of the monasteries they called home.
meanings.sent5: The monasteries were like big families, supporting each other through thick and thin.
